title: Synonyms & Antonyms
explanation: Synonyms are words with similar meaning, while antonyms are words with opposite meaning. This helps in contextual understanding and error spotting.
example: Rapid is a synonym of fast; ancient is an antonym of modern.
practice: Find synonym of 'brief' and antonym of 'scarce'.

title: Idioms & Phrases
explanation: Idioms are fixed expressions whose meanings are not literal. They are common in placement and govt exam verbal sections.
example: 'Hit the sack' means go to sleep.
practice: Use 'once in a blue moon' in a sentence.

title: One-word Substitution
explanation: Replace a phrase with a single precise word to improve expression and speed in objective exams.
example: A person who loves books: bibliophile.
practice: One-word substitution for 'fear of heights'.

title: Homophones & Homonyms
explanation: Homophones sound alike but differ in meaning/spelling; homonyms share spelling or pronunciation with different meanings.
example: Pair and pear are homophones.
practice: Choose correct word: 'Their/There' plans changed.

title: Parts of Speech
explanation: English words function as noun, pronoun, verb, adjective, adverb, preposition, conjunction, and interjection.
example: She quickly solved the puzzle. ('quickly' is an adverb)
practice: Identify parts of speech in: 'The old man walks slowly'.

title: Subject-Verb Agreement
explanation: The verb must agree with subject number/person. Indefinite pronouns and collective nouns are common traps.
example: Each of the students is ready.
practice: Choose correct: 'The team (is/are) playing well'.

title: Tenses
explanation: Tenses indicate time and aspect of action. Understand simple, continuous, perfect, and perfect continuous forms.
example: I have completed the assignment.
practice: Convert: 'He goes to class' into past perfect.

title: Error Spotting & Sentence Correction
explanation: Identify grammar, usage, and structure mistakes in sentences and choose corrected form.
example: Incorrect: He do not know. Correct: He does not know.
practice: Spot error: 'Neither of the boys are late'.

title: Reading Comprehension
explanation: RC checks ability to infer, summarize, and identify tone, fact, and assumption from passages.
example: Main idea questions test central argument of paragraph.
practice: Read a short passage and identify the authorâ€™s tone.

title: Para Jumbles & Completion
explanation: Arrange jumbled statements logically and choose sentence that best completes a paragraph.
example: Intro sentence generally sets context; pronouns often reference prior lines.
practice: Arrange four shuffled lines into coherent order.

title: Critical Reasoning
explanation: Evaluate arguments, assumptions, strengthen/weaken statements, and logical conclusions.
example: If evidence does not support claim, the argument weakens.
practice: Find hidden assumption in a short argument.

title: Syllogisms & Analogies
explanation: Syllogisms test deductive logic using quantified statements; analogies test relationship recognition.
example: All roses are flowers; some flowers fade -> some roses may fade.
practice: Complete analogy: Book : Read :: Song : ?

title: Number System
explanation: Covers integers, primes, HCF/LCM, divisibility, remainders, unit digit, surds, and indices.
practice: Find remainder when 2^10 is divided by 7.

title: Percentages, Profit & Loss, SI-CI
explanation: Core arithmetic topics for commerce and exam calculations including percentage change and interest.
example: If CP=100 and profit=20%, SP=120.
practice: Find CI on 10000 at 10% for 2 years.

title: Ratio, Proportion, Averages, Mixtures
explanation: Ratio-based distribution and weighted average concepts frequently appear in aptitude rounds.
example: Average of 10,20,30 is 20.
practice: Milk-water ratio 3:2 in 25L. Find milk quantity.

title: Time-Speed-Distance, Trains, Boats
explanation: Distance-rate-time relations with relative speed, stream speed, and train crossing concepts.
example: Speed = Distance / Time.
practice: Train 120m crosses pole in 6s. Find speed.

title: Time & Work, Pipes & Cisterns
explanation: Work rate method solves collaborative completion and filling/emptying problems.
example: If A does work in 10 days, rate of A is 1/10 per day.
practice: A in 12 days, B in 18 days. Together in ? days.

title: Algebra
explanation: Includes linear/quadratic equations, inequalities, logs, sequences, and function basics.
example: For x^2-5x+6=0, roots are 2 and 3.
practice: Solve 2x+3=15.

title: Geometry & Mensuration
explanation: Angles, triangles, circles, coordinate geometry, and 2D/3D mensuration formulas.
example: Area of circle = pi r^2.
practice: Find area of triangle with base 10 and height 8.

title: Permutation, Combination, Probability, Set Theory
explanation: Counting principles and uncertainty models for arrangement and selection questions.
practice: How many ways to choose 2 from 5?

title: Data Interpretation
explanation: Interpret tables, bar, line, pie, and caselet data quickly with percentage and ratio methods.
example: If sales rise from 40 to 50, increase is 25%.
practice: Read a sample bar chart and compare two categories.

title: Verbal Reasoning
explanation: Covers number/letter series, coding-decoding, blood relations, directions, clocks, calendars, ranking.
example: 2,4,8,16 follows multiplication by 2.
practice: Find next term: A, C, F, J, ?

title: Analytical Reasoning
explanation: Arrangement and puzzle-based reasoning requiring constraints, ordering, and elimination.
example: In a linear arrangement, fix absolute positions first.
practice: Arrange 5 people with given left-right clues.

title: Non-verbal Reasoning
explanation: Visual pattern topics including cubes, dice, paper folding, mirror images, and pattern completion.
example: Opposite faces in a cube remain opposite after rotations.
practice: Identify mirror image of given symbol.
